General.text:
Type:
Antibiotic
(cephalosporin/beta-lactamase inhibitor combination)
Dosage Forms: IV
Common Trade Names: Zerbaxa

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal Dosing: 750mg IV q8hr for moderate renal impairment, 375mg IV q8hr for severe impairment
Hepatic Dosing: no adjustment

Serious.text:
C. difficile diarrhea
Renal impairment
Hypersensitivity

C. difficile diarrhea
Renal impairment
Hypersensitivity

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Ceftolozane- ~3h, Tazobactam- ~1h
Metabolism: N/A
Excretion: Renal (100%)

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
Ceftolozane: cephalosporin- binds to bacterial PCN-binding proteins, thus inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis
Tazobactam: irreversibly inhibits some penicillinases and cephalosporinases and binds to some chromosomal and plasmid-mediated bacterial beta-lactamases
